intro: Scabiosa succisa var. ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf scabious, is a perennial plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and prefers well-drained, sunny soils. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
